item.title: The Value of Microbreaks
item.description: Why Learn More Efficiently? Already in 1885, Herman Ebinghaus noticed that learning could be done better. It is well known that more repetitions improves memory. However, two spaced learning sessions can be twice as efficient as two learning session without spacing. [ref KornMeier] Twice as efficient, that’s great! Consolidation happens during rest states. “Most, if not all skill learning occurs during rest” –> It is the time when neurons are rewired.
